snippet: Steel used in the Brooklyn arena was supposed to be installed with much stronger bolts than were used, prompting safety concerns and the replacement of many of them since it opened in September.
abstract: Engineers are replacing hundreds of weak steel bolts used in the construction of Brooklyn's Barclays Center; issue was discovered only one month before the arena's opening, prompting concerns about safety and communications between New York City Buildings Dept and Forest City Ratner, the site's developer.
lead_paragraph: Steel used in the Brooklyn arena was supposed to be installed with much stronger bolts than were used, prompting safety concerns and the replacement of many of them since it opened in September.

headline.seo: Weak Bolts Have Complicated the Barclays Center’s Early Days
headline.main: Problem With Weak Bolts Has Complicated the Barclays Center’s Early Days
headline.print_headline: Problem With Weak Bolts Has Complicated the Barclays Center’s Early Days
